fields.summary: [Django] Error (EXTERNAL IP): /questions/related_questions/

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47460].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
We can actually mark any number of topics as featured even though we only display 15 featured topics. Therefore, the numbers of featured topics which can be marked should be regulated no more than 15.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to "Questions" page and create more than 15 topics.
# Mark all topics as featured.

h3. Expected Results
We can't mark topics as featured from 16th one.

h3. Actual Results
We can mark any number of topics as featured.

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround.
fields.summary: Regulating numbers of featured topics no more than 15

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47453].
  {panel}

When you make a confluence question you need to assign at least one topic to it. If you try to write a topic in Chinese it doesn't work.

See video for example:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B5FxxgvgzRjLenBNMlEybEltSWM/view?usp=sharing

This could presumably affect Japanese input as well, but I haven't tested it.
fields.summary: Confluence questions topics is broken for Chinese input

  {panel}

When reputation-based permissions are enabled, the edit comment feature is broken. 

This happens because the {{EDIT_COMMENT}} permission is not defined in the list of {{DEFAULT_THRESHOLDS}} available in {{PluginSettingsPermissionThresholdRepository}}.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47447].
  {panel}

At the time of writing, the page https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Issue+Fields+in+JIRA+REST+APIs has a footer claiming 'These are the latest posts from Atlassian Answers relevant to this page', but the list provided:

a) is pretty much the same for all pages on http://developer.altlassian.com/
b) in fact has *zero* relevance to the page contents

As an added (but related) annoyance, when clicking on the link to 'Ask on Atlassian Answers' in order to 'have a comment or question on this page', it conducts a search of Answers based on the title of the linked-from-page.  (eg. [https://answers.atlassian.com/search/?t=&Submit=search&q=Issue%20Fields%20in%20JIRA%20REST%20APIs%20-%20JIRA%20Development]).  This is a missed opportunity.  It should conduct a search based on the referring URL.  Cisco use this to great advantage when a disccussion forum actually *links to* a specific page of doc.   See the bottom of http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/ps6120/products_configuration_example09186a00805e8c80.shtml for an example.  This is frequently quite useful.
fields.summary: Answers displayed on the bottom of developer reference pages are not relevant to the page.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47434].
  {panel}

h1. Scenario

I created [a CQ on EAC|https://extranet.atlassian.com/questions/2624885513/how-do-i-stop-amps-trying-to-load-the-tests-plugin?src=browse] with the labels {{amps}} and {{plugin-development}}.

If I go to the "[popular|https://extranet.atlassian.com/questions/topics/1751089174/amps?&filter=popular]" view for the {{amps}} label, I can see that question in the list, as expected (although oddly it appears at the top of the list despite other questions having more upvotes, but that's not the problem).

h1. Bugs

# If I go to the "[recent|https://extranet.atlassian.com/questions/topics/1751089174/amps?&filter=recent]" view for the {{amps}} label (which I assume is sorted in reverse date order), I cannot see that question; the first question in the list is older than mine. This seems wrong to me.
# If I go to the "[unanswered|https://extranet.atlassian.com/questions/topics/1751089174/amps?&filter=unanswered]" view for the {{amps}} label, I can't see my question either, even though it has no answers.

I've attached screenshots of these three views to show what I mean.
fields.summary: New question does not appear in "recent" or "unanswered" tabs for its labels

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47433].
  {panel}

I just had an email with a question,
- https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/156506/email-aliases-not-working-from-jira-email-handler

I clicked the link and posted a question, it asked me to login (I got a redirect to the Atlassian login page)

After authenticating, it lost the question I was looking at, and looking at the question, the answer was never posted.

Expected behaviour: redirect to question with original answer text.
Workaround: Disallow answers to be posted unless logged in.
fields.summary: posting an answer without being logged in causes that answer to be lost after logging in

h3. Summary
Topics cannot be deleted even if there are no questions or watchers
h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* Questions for Confluence Plugin 2.4.1-D20151021T063334
* Firefox, Chrome
* Windows, Mac

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a topic
# Delete the topic

h3. Expected Results
Topic is deleted
h3. Actual Results
There are no actions after user click on Delete button. Delete button will be grayed out

 !Screen Shot 2015-11-10 at 5.35.42 PM.png|thumbnail!  

h3. Notes
Topic cannot be deleted after questions and watchers are removed

h3.Workaround
No workaround at the moment

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47414].
  {panel}

Hey guys, I use answers.atlassian.com every day, and today something strange has happened -- all answers are translated into Russian language! It seems to be a Google auto-translation, or something else. I'm a Russian and I can read Russian ok, but the problem is that automatic translation often makes no sense at all. Is this a new feature? Please let me turn it off!

Strangely though, the questions are still in English.

Thanks for your support!
Igor
fields.summary: All answers are translated to Russian

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47394].
  {panel}

{panel}
h3. Summary

When trying to edit the permissions for Questions for Confluence, an error occurs.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence 1000.223.0
 * Questions for Confluence 2.4.14-D20160804T002212
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to *General Configuration* >> *Permissions* (under the Questions for Confluence section)
 # Click the *Edit Permissions* button.
h3. Expected Results

You are taken to the page where you can edit permissions for the add-on.
h3. Actual Results

Page loads at: https://<HOSTNAME>.atlassian.net/wiki/admin/questions/editpermissions.action
 The below exception is thrown:
{noformat}
 javax.servlet.ServletException: Servlet execution threw an exception
     at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:326)

caused by: java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: com.atlassian.confluence.security.administrators.EditGlobalPermissionsAdministrator.<init>(Lcom/atlassian/confluence/security/SpacePermissionManager;Lcom/atlassian/confluence/security/administrators/PermissionResolver;Lcom/atlassian/confluence/security/SetSpacePermissionChecker;Lcom/atlassian/confluence/user/SearchEntitiesManager;Lcom/atlassian/confluence/util/UserChecker;Lcom/atlassian/confluence/user/UserAccessor;)V
     at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.questions.actions.admin.ExtendedEditPermissionsAdministrator.<init>(ExtendedEditPermissionsAdministrator.java:37)

{noformat}
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround. 
  
{panel}
